summary:
Economics is a social science that explores how people and societies manage resources. It looks at how goods and services are made, distributed, and used. Microeconomics focuses on individual parts of the economy, like buyers and sellers, while macroeconomics studies the entire system, including factors like labor and growth.

Economics can be divided into different categories, such as positive (describing facts) and normative (suggesting improvements). It has many applications, helping us understand business, government, health, and even social issues like crime and education.
title: Economics
